frameDefinitions: Due to chemical, nuclear, or other reactions, an Explosive explodes, potentially causing damage to the surrounding area.
An Agent causes a Useful_location to become accessible (or non-accessible) to a Theme to a certain Degree.
A Winner has victory over an Loser.
This frame covers the basic uses of direction words like the adverbs east, up, and forward.
A generally large group of people, the Combatants, are engaged in a chaotic, violent, and usually protracted Fight amongst themselves.
An Agent suddenly and often violently separates the Whole_patient into two or more smaller Pieces, resulting in the Whole_patient no longer existing as such.
frameExamples: The bomb <t>exploded</t> in the middle of the plaza.
They've <t>blockaded</t> the entrance -- no one can get in or out.
He <t>ripped</t> <t>up</t> the letter faster than you can say 'Jack Robbins'. INI
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Explosive</fen> releases a large amount of force, destroying itself and causing damage to the surrounding area.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the explosion occurs.
The location where the explosion occurs.
The <fen>Agent</fen> blocks access to the <fen>Useful_location</fen>.
The <fen>Useful_location</fen> is the place the <fen>Theme</fen> is headed towards and the <fen>Agent</fen> has changed the accessibility of.

The <fen>Agent</fen> may regulate access to the <fen>Useful_location</fen> by regulating access to a <fen>Portal</fen>, including a part of the portal that could block potential <fen>Theme</fen>s, such as doors or gates.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> changes the accessibility of the <fen>Useful_location</fen>.
The general <fen>Place</fen> where the blocking or allowing of access occurs.
The individual or individuals who beat the <fen>Loser</fen>.
The individual or individuals that get beat by the <fen>Winner</fen>.
When the <fen>Winner</fen> has victory over the <fen>Loser</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Winner</fen> has victory <fen>Loser</fen>.
The one-dimensional set of locations.
The <fen>Combatants</fen> participate as fighters in the <fen>Fight</fen>.
The violent activity.
When the <fen>Fight</fen> takes place.
Where the <fen>Fight</fen> takes place.
The conscious entity, generally a person, that performs the intentional action that results in the <fen>Whole_patient</fen> being broken into <fen>Pieces</fen>.
The entity which is destroyed by the <fen>Agent</fen> and that ends up broken into <fen>Pieces</fen>.
The fragments of the <fen>Whole_patient</fen> that result from the <fen>Agent</fen>'s action.
An event which leads to the fragmentation of the <fen>Whole_patient</fen>.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> breaks up the <fen>Whole_patient</fen>.
This role identifies the place where the <fen>Agent</fen> breaks the <fen>Whole_patient</fen> into pieces.
listRoleExamples: <fex>The bomb</fex> exploded in the middle of the plaza.
<fex>Police</fex> have cordoned off the area where the crime took place.
Protestors barricaded <fex>a highway that connects the industrial sectors to the ports</fex>.
They've blockaded <fex>the entrance</fex> -- no one can get in or out.
A rebel group blockaded the roadways <fex>late last night</fex>.
Many roads were cordorned off <fex>in the central district</fex> right after the incident.
The football referee's controversial call led to a bloody free-for-all <fex>among the fans</fex>.
I couldn't help but watch as several bruised people reentered the <fex><t>melee</t></fex>.
<fex>I and I alone</fex> can shatter the gem and break the curse.
Shattering someone's confidence is a little different than shattering <fex>a dish</fex>.
I smashed the toy boat <fex>to flinders</fex>.
